entries.meaning: (figurative) One who sucks up; a bootlicker, ass-kisser, sycophant.
examples: A workmate reported the matter, "which is why the worker threatened to beat up the latter," calling him a "brownnose" and threatening to "wipe the floor with him."

verbs.description: brownnose (third-person singular simple present brownnoses, present participle brownnosing, simple past and past participle brownnosed)

entries.meaning: To flatter someone (especially a superior) in an obsequious manner, and to support their every opinion.
